components.name: ZenAvatarComponent

propertiesClass.name: src
propertiesClass.description: Path to the image source. If the src is provided, an image element will be rendered. Otherwise, the content projected into this component will be displayed.
propertiesClass.rawdescription:
Path to the image source. If the `src` is provided, an image element will be rendered.
Otherwise, the content projected into this component will be displayed.

components.description:
A component to display an avatar image. If a valid image source URL is provided, it will render an image element. Otherwise, it will display projected content.

The component uses Angular's optimized image directives for enhanced performance.

Usage:

Example :
<!-- If an image source is provided, it will display the image -->
<zen-avatar [src]="'/path/to/image.jpg'" />

<!-- If no image source is provided, it will display the projected content -->
<zen-avatar> A </zen-avatar>
Example :
<zen-avatar src="https://picsum.photos/32" />

See {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}
components.rawdescription:
A component to display an avatar image. If a valid image source URL is provided,
it will render an image element. Otherwise, it will display projected content.

The component uses Angular's optimized image directives for enhanced performance.

Usage:

```html
<!-- If an image source is provided, it will display the image -->
<zen-avatar [src]="'/path/to/image.jpg'" />

<!-- If no image source is provided, it will display the projected content -->
<zen-avatar> A </zen-avatar>
```

```html
<zen-avatar src="https://picsum.photos/32" />
```

See {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}

components.name: ZenBadgeComponent
components.template:
<ng-content />
<ng-content select="[topLeft]" />
<ng-content select="[top]" />
<ng-content select="[topRight]" />
<ng-content select="[left]" />
<ng-content select="[right]" />
<ng-content select="[bottomLeft]" />
<ng-content select="[bottom]" />
<ng-content select="[bottomRight]" />
components.description:
ZenBadgeComponent is a versatile Angular component used to display badges or indicators in various positions within its parent container. It allows for flexible placement of badge content such as icons, text, or other elements in the top-left, top, top-right, left, right, bottom-left, bottom, and bottom-right positions.

This component offers standalone usage and is highly customizable through its template and styling. It leverages Angular's change detection strategy 'OnPush' for optimal performance.

Additionally, it provides support for CSS variables to customize badge positioning

Example :
--zen-badge-offset: unset; // Controls the overall offset of the badge
--zen-badge-offset-x: unset; // Controls the horizontal offset of the badge.
--zen-badge-offset-y: unset; // Controls the vertical offset of the badge.
Example :

See {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}
components.rawdescription:
ZenBadgeComponent is a versatile Angular component used to display badges or indicators
in various positions within its parent container. It allows for flexible placement
of badge content such as icons, text, or other elements in the top-left, top,
top-right, left, right, bottom-left, bottom, and bottom-right positions.

This component offers standalone usage and is highly customizable through its
template and styling. It leverages Angular's change detection strategy 'OnPush'
for optimal performance.

Additionally, it provides support for CSS variables to customize badge positioning

```css
--zen-badge-offset: unset; // Controls the overall offset of the badge
--zen-badge-offset-x: unset; // Controls the horizontal offset of the badge.
--zen-badge-offset-y: unset; // Controls the vertical offset of the badge.
```

```html
```

See {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}
components.sourceCode: import { ChangeDetectionStrategy, Component, ViewEncapsulation, } from '@angular/core'; /** * ZenBadgeComponent is a versatile Angular component used to display badges or indicators * in various positions within its parent container. It allows for flexible placement * of badge content such as icons, text, or other elements in the top-left, top, * top-right, left, right, bottom-left, bottom, and bottom-right positions. * * This component offers standalone usage and is highly customizable through its * template and styling. It leverages Angular's change detection strategy 'OnPush' * for optimal performance. * * Additionally, it provides support for CSS variables to customize badge positioning * * ```css * --zen-badge-offset: unset; // Controls the overall offset of the badge * --zen-badge-offset-x: unset; // Controls the horizontal offset of the badge. * --zen-badge-offset-y: unset; // Controls the vertical offset of the badge. * ``` * * @example Text 🦆 * * @component * @selector `zen-badge`,`[zenBadge]` * * @license BSD-2-Clause * @author Konrad Stępień * @see {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository} */ @Component({ selector: 'zen-badge,[zenBadge]', standalone: true, template: ` `, styleUrl: './badge.component.scss', encapsulation: ViewEncapsulation.None, changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush, }) export class ZenBadgeComponent {}

components.name: ZenButtonComponent
components.description:
ZenButtonComponent is a reusable button component designed to provide a consistent and customizable button style across the application. It can be used with both <button> and <a> HTML elements by applying the zen-button attribute.

Example :
<button zen-button> ... </button>

See {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}
components.rawdescription:
ZenButtonComponent is a reusable button component designed to provide
a consistent and customizable button style across the application.
It can be used with both `<button>` and `<a>` HTML elements by applying
the `zen-button` attribute.

```html
<button zen-button> ... </button>
```

See {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}

components.name: ZenCheckboxComponent

propertiesClass.name: value
propertiesClass.description: Model for the checked state of the checkbox.
propertiesClass.rawdescription: Model for the checked state of the checkbox.

methodsClass.name: initIndeterminate
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Initializes the indeterminate state of the checkbox based on the checked state.
If the checked state is 'mixed', the checkbox will be set to indeterminate.
methodsClass.description: Initializes the indeterminate state of the checkbox based on the checked state. If the checked state is 'mixed', the checkbox will be set to indeterminate.

methodsClass.name: registerOnChange
methodsClass.rawdescription: Registers a function to be called when the value changes.
methodsClass.description: Registers a function to be called when the value changes.

methodsClass.name: registerOnTouched
methodsClass.rawdescription: Registers a function to be called when the component is touched.
methodsClass.description: Registers a function to be called when the component is touched.

methodsClass.name: setDisabledState
methodsClass.rawdescription: Sets the disabled state of the component.
methodsClass.description: Sets the disabled state of the component.

methodsClass.name: setValue
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Toggles the checkbox value and notifies the change.
If the component is disabled, no action is performed.
methodsClass.description: Toggles the checkbox value and notifies the change. If the component is disabled, no action is performed.

methodsClass.name: writeValue
methodsClass.rawdescription: Writes a new value to the component.
methodsClass.description: Writes a new value to the component.

components.description:
ZenCheckboxComponent is a custom checkbox component implementing ControlValueAccessor. It supports a tri-state checkbox (checked, unchecked, and indeterminate).

Example :
<zen-checkbox />

See {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}
components.rawdescription:
ZenCheckboxComponent is a custom checkbox component implementing ControlValueAccessor.
It supports a tri-state checkbox (checked, unchecked, and indeterminate).

```html
<zen-checkbox />
```

See {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}

components.name: ZenTagComponent
components.description:
The ZenTagComponent is a reusable UI component designed to display a tag or label. It allows for custom content to be projected inside the tag.

Example :
<zen-tag>...</zen-tag>
Example :

See {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}
components.rawdescription:
The `ZenTagComponent` is a reusable UI component designed to display a tag or label.
It allows for custom content to be projected inside the tag.

```html
<zen-tag>...</zen-tag>
```

```html
```
See {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}
components.sourceCode:
import { ChangeDetectionStrategy, Component } from '@angular/core';

/**
 * The `ZenTagComponent` is a reusable UI component designed to display a tag or label.
 * It allows for custom content to be projected inside the tag.
 *
 * ```html
 * <zen-tag>...</zen-tag>
 * ```
 *
 * @example <zen-tag>Simple tag</zen-tag>
 * @component
 * @selector `zen-tag`
 *
 * @license BSD-2-Clause
 * @author Konrad Stępień <kord.stp@gmail.com>
 * @see {https://github.com/Kordrad/ng-zen GitHub Repository}
 */
@Component({
  selector: 'zen-tag',
  standalone: true,
  template: `<ng-content />`,
  styleUrl: './tag.component.scss',
  changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush,
})
export class ZenTagComponent {}
